page.title: 04BRIGHSTONE CHURCH
page.content: The pretty church in Brighstone is dedicated to St. Mary The Virgin. It was built about 800 years ago to cope with the increasing population. It is the daughter church to the older one at Calbourne. We were allowed to climb up to the top of the tower, the spiral steps were very narrow. When we reached the top it was breezy. From there we could see the whole of Brighstone. Coming down we stopped to look at the bells.Recently a colony of bats has taken up residence in the belfry making more regular cleaning essential! The church has boards with information on them for tourists. The stained glass windows are very beautiful. Around them there are scrolls and leaves painted on the wall.
